title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools - R focus
text:
üóìÔ∏è September 16, 2025
‚è∞ 9:00 am - 5:00 pm
üè® ROOM TBD
‚úçÔ∏è pos.it/conf

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools - R focus
text:
Welcome
These are the materials for a one-day workshop on Building Data Science Workflows in R Using Posit Tools on September 16, 2025 at posit::conf 2025!
In this R-focused workshop, we will discuss ways to improve your data science workflows. During the course, we will review packages for data validation, alerting, modeling, and more. We‚Äôll use Posit‚Äôs open source and professional tools to string all the pieces together for an efficient workflow. We‚Äôll discuss environments, managing deployed content, working with databases, and interoperability across data products.

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools - R focus
text:
Prework

Bring your laptop

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools - R focus
text:
Materials

Workshop materials for the Posit Cola project are available at: https://github.com/posit-conf-2025/ds-workflows-r
Slides used during the workshop are organized by section:

01 - Workshop and Project Introduction
02 - Data Retrieval and Database Essentials
03 - Data Validation and Alerting
04 - Modeling and MLOps
05 - Delivering Insights Effectively
06 - Managing Environments

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools - R focus
text:
Resources
We cover a lot of ground. See the list of resources for references to come back to.

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools - R focus
text:
Instructors
Ryan Johnson, Data Science Advisor, Posit

Ryan is a Data Science Advisor at Posit with a background in Microbiology and Bioinformatics. He obtained his Ph.D.¬†from the Uniformed Services University in Maryland and did his postdoctoral training at the National Human Genome Research Institute, NIH. In his current role, Ryan serves as a data science advocate and hosts workshops and webinars for teams across the globe.
Katie Masiello, Solutions Engineer, Posit

Katie Masiello is a Solutions Engineer at Posit. A mechanical engineer by training, she found her calling in data science while working statistical analysis in the aerospace industry. A good cup of coffee, reproducibility, and making life easier for the next user are three things she loves most. Katie is an avid knitter and knitr, and she can often be found trying to tame her ridiculously overgrown garden, collecting pebbles, or thinking about taking up running as a hobby.

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools - R focus
text:
Acknowledgments

This website, including the slides, is made with Quarto. Please submit an issue on the GitHub repo for this workshop if you find something that could be fixed or improved.

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools - R focus
text:
Notice

The data used in this workshop is synthetic and generated by AI. It is for illustrative purposes only and does not represent actual company data or reflect any real-world performance.

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools
section: Washington State Ferry Depature Delays Project
text:
Washington State Ferry Depature Delays Project



The Question


Can we predict departure delay for a given route and date?






Our Approach


Use the historical (validated) delay, location, and weather data to create a model that will predict the likelihood of delays!

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools
text:
Project Data
This workshop will use data from two primary data sources:

‚õ¥Ô∏é Ferry data (https://wsdot.wa.gov/traffic/api/)
üå§Ô∏è Weather data (https://open-meteo.com/en/docs/historical-weather-api/)

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools
text:
Project Data Details

 ‚õ¥Ô∏é Ferry data (https://wsdot.wa.gov/traffic/api/)








Data Set
Description
API




Vessel verbose
Details about each ferry in the fleet, including name, model, and capacity
https://www.wsdot.wa.gov/ferries/api/ vessels/rest/vesselverbose? apiaccesscode={WSDOT_ACCESS_CODE}


Vessel history
Historical sailings, including scheduled actual departure time
https://www.wsdot.wa.gov/ferries/api/ vessels/rest/vesselhistory/ {VESSELNAME}/{DATESTART}/{DATEEND}? apiaccesscode={WSDOT_ACCESS_CODE}


Terminal locations
Terminal names and locations, including latitude and longitude
https://www.wsdot.wa.gov/ferries/ api/terminals/rest/terminallocations? apiaccesscode={WSDOT_ACCESS_CODE}

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools
text:
Project Data Details

 üå§Ô∏è Weather data (https://open-meteo.com/en/docs/historical-weather-api/)








Endpoint
Description
API




Historical weather
Historical hourly weather at a specified latitude and longitude over a date range
https://archive-api.open-meteo.com/v1/ archive?{params}

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools
text:
Project Objective

Provide users travelers with a self-service tool that predicts the likelihood of a ferry departure delay.


Project Requirements


ü§ñ Automate the pipeline
‚ö†Ô∏è Receive alerts if there are issues in the pipeline
üîÑ Project is easy to maintain and iterate upon
 Work is reusable by other teams, even if they don‚Äôt use R (Lookin‚Äô at you )

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools
text:
Workbench Setup // Step 2



Click New Session
Start a RStudio Pro session
Create a new project from a version control repository
Select Git
Add the workshops GitHub Repo URL ‚Äì> https://github.com/posit-conf-2025/ds-workflows-r.git
Call the project directory ds-workflows-r
Leave everything else as default. Select Create Project.

title: Data Science Workflows with Posit Tools
text:
Saving your work üíæ

All source material can be found on the GitHub page: https://github.com/posit-conf-2025/ds-workflows-r
The environment we‚Äôre working on will stay on for a few days after conf‚Ä¶but that‚Äôs it!
If you would like to save your work, we recommend:

Exporting any source code to your local machine.
Fork the project to a personal GitHub Repo.
